A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Giving it one star is being generous\, as I have never had such high expectations for a movie (and no\, I'm not one of those fans upset because his fan theories didn't go as planned) only to be let down tremendously.  I never felt a feeling of hopelessness after seeing what this movie destroyed\, the great semblance of the universe that made Star Wars great.   With conflicting plot holes\, superfluous slap-stick comedy\, general out-of-character development and lack of development in general\, an inconsistent tone and pacing\, there was no Star Wars that was esoteric for us fans for so many years.  I understand what Johnson tried to do making it \"his own\"\, but you cannot achieve that when you try to undermine something that is already built with a story in place.  If you want to do that in your own saga\, set in the far past or future\, then by all means\, I would be all for it.   I just hope Episode 9 can redeem what little hope there is to making the next chapter remotely enjoyable.
